Two users encrypted secrets, but their keys shared a prime. Recover the original message from 2681394288102053370950013232354149461030969910798794897003239057514106391871647200526021431481385773464333313027670331827742841732089675926377083689559187.

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8206047600142286202059950282578136046868615589327209534601518854031142810520292794206816669377118070118215712367452630194425955469937902765385734989963177, n2=7960368908177684407818496042915024372094273039129984498055145578536731708437116216207554545090857332175992061945428364381132930263938942597650027458218061, e=2555367800553120979822301432276902952141842976743763418900968954868888184901222458764706223045895577199232991874030446752630413380483918400159354660767511

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{cd8k3grq}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2681394288102053370950013232354149461030969910798794897003239057514106391871647200526021431481385773464333313027670331827742841732089675926377083689559187
vulnerability: shared prime
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common prime, computing GCD(n, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
